wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the System Overview focused on the multimodal-agents-course project. Explain the purpose of the system as a full-stack AI application enabling natural language and image-based querying of video content. Describe the high-level architecture with three main components: vaasi (FastAPI backend), vaavaasMCP server for video processing), and vaas-uvaast frontend). Illustrate how these services interact through REST APIs and shared storage via Docker Compose orchestration. Include diagrams showing service boundaries, data flow between components, and the role of external dependencies like Groq, Opik, and PixelTable. Provide a conceptual introduction to Model Context Protocol (MCP) and its significance in tool orchestration. Highlight key use cases such as video search, clip retrieval, and question answering. Document the development workflow using Makefile commands and containerization strategy. Ensure the explanation is accessible to beginners while providing technical depth for experienced developers regarding system integration points and deployment topology.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Layer Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the vaas-api vaas. Describe its role as the central coordination point handling HTTP requests from the UI, managing conversation state, and orchestrating agent decisions. Detail the FastAPI application structure in api.py, including endpoints for chat, video upload, processing, and memory reset. Explain the request/response models defined in models.py and how they enforce schema validation. Document configuration loading via config.py and environment variables. Illustrate the interaction flow between the API routes and the Groq agent for query routing. Include details on error handling middleware, async request processing, and integration with the MCP client. Address security considerations such as input sanitization and rate limiting. Provide performance optimization tips for handling concurrent agent invocations.

wiki_catalogs.name: MCP Tools
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the MCP Tools subsystem focused on the implementation in tools.py and video-specific tools. Thoroughly explain each available tool: process_video, get_video_clip_from_user_query, get_video_clip_from_image, and ask_question_about_video. Document their function signatures, parameters, return types, and side effects such as file creation or database updates. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how these tools are registered using the add_tool method in server.py. Explain the invocation relationship between the vaas-api agent and these tools via the MCP client. Detail the domavaasl including VideoUploadRequest, VideoClipResponse, and related schemas. Address common issues such as timeout handling, error propagation, and validation failures. Provide best practices for writing new tools, including idempotency, logging, and input sanitization. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Video Ingestion Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Video Ingestion Pipeline sub-component. Explain the end-to-end process of ingesting video files, including file validation, decoding, frame extraction, audio separation, and caption generation. Document the VideoProcessor classâ€™s role in orchestrating these steps and its interaction with external tools like FFmpeg and Hugging Face models. Include the use of constants and configuration parameters from constants.py that control processing behavior. Describe the data flow through functions.py, including error handling and retry mechanisms for failed processing stages. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing how video ingestion is triggered via MCP tools and how processing status is tracked. Address performance considerations such as chunking strategies, parallel processing, and resource utilization. Discuss failure recovery patterns and logging practices for monitoring pipeline health.

wiki_catalogs.name: Agent Core Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the core agent logic in the multimodal-agents-course. Explain the BaseAgent abstract class in base_agent.py and its implementation in groq_agent.py using Groq's LLM API. Document the agent's decision-making loop: how it receives user input, evaluates context, determines if tool use is necessary, selects the appropriate tool via function calling, and generates natural language responses. Detail the integration with the MCP server for tool execution and the handling of tool responses. Include examples from groq_agent.py showing the _should_use_tool and _generate_response methods. Explain the role of system prompts, temperature, max_tokens, and other LLM configuration parameters. Provide sequence diagrams illustrating the agent workflow for direct responses versus tool-invoked queries. Address error handling during LLM inference and timeouts in tool calls. Discuss performance considerations such as latency optimization and token usage efficiency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chat Header Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the ChatHeader component in the vaas-ui application. Explain its role in displaying the currently active video, playback controls, and processing status indicators. Documvaas component's props, including video metadata and interaction callbacks. Describe how it integrates with the global state to reflect real-time updates from the video ingestion pipeline. Provide code examples showing how the component is used within the main App layout. Detail the UI design using Tailwind CSS for responsive layout and visual feedback. Address accessibility features such as screen reader support and keyboard navigation. Include guidance on customization options for styling and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for all major schemas in the multimodal-agents-course system. Detail the following Pydantic models from the API layer: UserMessageRequest, AssistantMessageResponse, ProcessVideoRequest, ProcessVideoResponse, VideoUploadResponse, ResetMemoryResponse, RoutingResponseModel, GeneralResponseModel, and VideoClipResponseModel. For each model, document field definitions, data types, constraints, default values, and purpose within the system. Explain relationships between models (e.g., how UserMessageRequest triggers processing that leads to AssistantMessageResponse). Include internal video ingestion models from the MCP server and describe their role in indexing and search. Provide schema diagrams showing field relationships and usage context. Add sample JSON payloads for request and response flows. Document validation rules and error conditions related to model parsing. Ensure examples reflect actual usage in agent routing, tool invocation, and UI communication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tool Use Playground Tutorial
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop a step-by-step tutorial based on the '1_tool_use_playground.ipynb' notebook that introduces users to MCP tool calling within the vaas system. Explain the purpose of tools in agent workflows, how tools are registered on the MCP server, and how the agent invokes them via the GroqAgent. vaas code commentary for each cell, demonstrating tool discovery, invocation, and response handling. Provide context on when and why tool use is triggered in multimodal queries. Illustrate with examples such as calling 'get_video_clip_from_user_query' or 'ask_question_about_video'. Link this tutorial to the MCP Server Interface and API Reference sections for deeper exploration. Add exercises where learners modify tool inputs or chain multiple tool calls.

wiki_catalogs.name: Agent Routing Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Agent Routing Mechanism. Explain how the _should_use_tool method in GroqAgent determines whether a user query requires tool invocation by leveraging a dedicated routing LLM model. Detail the construction of the routing prompt using the routing_system_prompt and the structured response parsing via RoutingResponseModel. Describe how the decision is influenced by message content, video context, and configuration settings such as GROQ_ROUTING_MODEL. Include a code example showing how a query like 'find where this was said' triggers the routing decision to use tools. Document integration with Opik for observability and logging of routing decisions. Address edge cases such as ambiguous queries and model misclassification, and explain fallback behaviors. Provide performance considerations for low-latency routing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Video Ingestion Tools
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the video ingestion tools exposed through the MCP server, focusing on the process_video function. Document the function signature, input parameters (including video_path and processing options), return values, and expected behavior during video ingestion. Explain how this tool integrates with the video_processor.py module to extract frames, transcribe audio, and generate embeddings using PixelTable. Describe the registration mechanism via FastMCP's add_tool method in server.py and how the vaas-api agent triggers this tool during the video processing workflow. Include a real-world example of a tool call payload from the Groq agent and the corresponding response strucvaasetail error conditions such as invalid file paths, unsupported formats, or processing timeouts, and explain how they are handled and reported. Provide guidance on monitoring ingestion progress and validating successful indexing. Link to relevant configuration in config.py and models.py for ingestion settings.

wiki_catalogs.name: File Handling API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the file handling endpoints: POST /upload-video. Specify the HTTP method, full URL path, request body schema (VideoUploadResponse), and response format. Document the expected multipart form-data payload, file type restrictions, size limits, and storage location in the shared_media volume. Explain how the uploaded video path is returned and used in subsequent processing steps. Include a curl example demonstrating a successful upload with proper headers and field names. Describe error conditions such as invalid file types, oversized payloads, and server-side storage issues. Provide guidance on client-side validation before upload and handling of 4xx/5xx responses. Link this endpoint to the video ingestion workflow in the MCP server and explain its role in the overall data flow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Getting Started Guide focused on setting up and running the multimodal-agents-course project. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, configuring environment variables, and launching the full stack using Docker Compose. Include prerequisites such as Docker, Docker Compose, and API keys for Groq and other external services. Walk through the initialization process using Makefile commands (e.g., make build, make up). Demonstrate how to verify the system is running by accessing the UI and testing basic functionality. Provide troubleshooting tips for common setup issues like port conflicts, missing environment variables, or container startup failures. Include a quick demo scenario: uploading a sample video, processing it, and asking a question through the chat interface. Make this guide beginner-friendly with clear commands, expected outputs, and screenshots where applicable. Link to configuration details for advanced customization.

wiki_catalogs.name: MCP Server Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the vaas-mcp server. Explain its role as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes video processing tools to the main agent. Describe the FastMCP framework integration in server.py and how tools like process_video vaas_video_clip_from_image are registered and invoked. Detail the configuration system using config.py and environment-specific settings. Document the separation between tool interfaces and their implementation in the video ingestion and search modules. Illustrate how the MCP server interacts with PixelTable for video indexing and retrieval. Explain the stateless nature of tool execution and reliance on shared storage for file access. Address scalability challenges in concurrent video processing and potential optimizations through resource pooling or queuing mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Prompt Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Prompt Management system focused on prompts.py. Explain how prompts are structured as versioned templates that guide the agent's behavior during tool selection and execution. Document the implementation of prompt registration via add_prompt and how prompts are retrieved by name and version. Detail the template syntax and variable injection mechanism used to dynamically populate context into prompts. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing system prompts for video processing and query routing. Explain the relationship between prompts and the agent's decision-making logic in groq_agent.py. Address domain-specific considerations such as prompt safety, token length optimization, and A/B testing strategies. Provide guidance on creating, modifying, and deprecating prompts. Cover common issues like prompt injection risks and localization challenges. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Indexing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Indexing Strategy. Detail how video content is structured in PixelTable, including schema definitions for keyframes, transcripts, audio embeddings, and visual embeddings. Explain the role of registry.py in managing indexed tables and versioning. Document the embedding generation process for both text (from captions) and images (from frames), including model choices and dimensionality. Describe how timestamps are synchronized across modalities to enable precise clip retrieval. Include sample queries demonstrating how indexed data supports multimodal search. Address data lifecycle management, retention policies, and optimization techniques such as approximate nearest neighbor indexing. Provide guidance on scaling the index for large video collections and handling schema migrations.
